name: Ker Sangri
history: Ker Sangri is a traditional dish from Rajasthan, known for its unique combination of ker berries and sangri beans. It's a desert delicacy, typically prepared in dry regions.
description: Ker Sangri is a dry curry made from ker berries and sangri beans, cooked with a variety of spices. It's known for its tangy and spicy flavor, often served as a side dish with roti or rice.

instructions.title: Prepare Ker and Sangri
instructions.description: Soak ker and sangri in water overnight or for at least 4-5 hours. Drain and wash thoroughly.

instructions.title: Cook the Ingredients
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and asafoetida. Once they crackle, add the ker and sangri. Cook for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Simmer
instructions.description: Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add a little water and let it simmer until the ker and sangri are cooked and the flavors are well combined.

instructions.title: Finalize and Serve
instructions.description: Stir in amchur powder. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot with roti or rice.

tips: Ensure ker and sangri are well soaked to reduce cooking time.
Adjust the amount of red chili powder as per your spice preference.
variations: Add chopped onions and tomatoes for a different flavor.
For a tangier taste, increase the amount of amchur.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional bowl, garnished with coriander leaves.
Pair with warm flatbread or steamed rice.
